meanings.definition: The range or distance that can be seen with the naked eye.
meanings.sent1: From the top of the hill, the eyeshots of the city were breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: She admired the eyeshots of the vast ocean from the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The eyeshots of the tiny ants marching in a line amused the curious child.
meanings.sent4: His eyeshots reached the horizon, where the sky met the sea.
meanings.sent5: The eyeshots of the colorful sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A quick glance or brief look.
meanings.sent1: With a swift eyeshot, she scanned the room for her lost keys.
meanings.sent2: He caught a quick eyeshot of the mysterious figure before it disappeared into the crowd.
meanings.sent3: In a single eyeshot, she knew he was up to mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her eyeshot at the clock revealed she was running late.
meanings.sent5: The eyeshot she gave him conveyed both surprise and delight.

meanings.definition: A shot or attempt made with the eyes.
meanings.sent1: His sly eyeshot towards his friend signaled their secret plan.
meanings.sent2: She made an eyeshot at her brother to stop talking during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The eyeshot she aimed at the waiter for more water went unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: His eyeshot at the basketball hoop was off, missing the target completely.
meanings.sent5: With a confident eyeshot, she convinced him to join the adventure.
